column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of Np2Co17 and Lu2T17 were prepared by arc melting stoichiometric amounts of high-purity elemental constituents (99.9% Np, 99.9% Lu, 99.999% Co and Ni) on a water-cooled copper hearth, under Ar (99.9999%) atmosphere.
#Text=A Zr alloy was used as an oxygen getter.
#Text=The weight losses during melting were less than 0.2%.
#Text=The samples were melted five times to improve the homogeneity, then wrapped in tantalum foils, and annealed at 800 ◦C in evacuated quartz ampoules for 1 week.
#Text=Phase analysis of the obtained ingots was performed before and after annealing.
#Text=Crystallographic analyses were performed at room temperature by x-ray diffraction on samples with a mass of about 25 mg, ground, and dispersed on a Si wafer.
#Text=Data were collected in back-reflection mode with a Bruker D8 diffractometer installed inside a α-γ glove box, using Cu-Kα1 radiation selected by a Ge (111) monochromator.
#Text=A 1D position sensitive detector was used to cover the angular range from 15 to 120 degrees, with incremental steps of 0.0085 degrees.
